newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PHILIPPINE STOCKS - factors to watch - Jan 22.
newsitem.headline: PHILIPPINE STOCKS - factors to watch - Jan 22.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Philippine stocks on Wednesday:
* On Tuesday, the Dow Jones rose 40.03 points to 6,883.90. PLDT's ADR also rose $0 1/8 to $57 1/4.
* On Tuesday, the peso weakened to 26.315 to a U.S. dollar from 26.312.
* The Philippine Stock Exchange index closed at 3,279.23, down 1.62.
* The Philippine interbank call loan average rate was steady at 10.53215 percent.
* The Business World newspaper said a government wage panel approved a 20-peso increase in the daily minimum wages of private sector employees in Metro Manila.
* Business World said DMCI Holdings Inc acquired a 40 percent stake in Semirara Coal Corp after buying more than 50 billion shares in the firm.
* The Philippine Daily Inquirer newspaper said three Dutch financial institutions led by ING Bank are syndicating a $110 million term loan facility for Pilipino Telephone Corp.
* The Manila Bulletin newspaper said the Department of Energy proposed to President Fidel Ramos a full oil industry deregulation on February 8.
